poem:
Title: "The Fractured Mirror of Europe"

Concrete walls rise within hearts once open,
A threnody for union sung in votes.
Liberal leaves fall, Greens' dreams broken,
On Parliament's stern floor, silence gloats.
Twilight engulfs the scarlet Socialists' hopes,
While sceptics twist hands around a mustard sun.
Centre-left, stumbles, then gropes,
In the morning's cold, what has Europe won?
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How can Europe’s progressives fight back? A coalition of losers is now their best hope | Paul Taylor For Europe’s centre-left, it was the night from hell. Liberals and Greens took a beating in many countries and lost dozens of seats as nationalist and Eurosceptic parties grabbed nearly a quarter of the seats in the European parliament. The centre-left Socialists and Democrats (S&D) slipped just below their existing total thanks to unexpectedly strong scores in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
